batch_narrative: azure_status: new 'Partial Recovery of ongoing Service Degr'.

new.headline: Partial Recovery of ongoing Service Degradation in West US region

content.excerpt_text: Impact Statement Starting at 08:00 UTC on 07 February 2026, a subset of customers using Azure services in the West US region may experience intermittent service unavailability or delays in monitoring and log data for some resources hosted in the affected datacenter areas. Impacted services include Web Apps, Application Insights, Azure Confidential Compute, Azure Container Registry, Azure Data Factory, Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server, Azure Databricks, Azure IoT Hub, Azure...

source_payload.html:
Impact Statement

Starting at 08:00 UTC on 07 February 2026, a subset of customers using Azure services in the West US region may experience intermittent service unavailability or delays in monitoring and log data for some resources hosted in the affected datacenter areas. Impacted services include Web Apps, Application Insights, Azure Confidential Compute, Azure Container Registry, Azure Data Factory, Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server, Azure Databricks, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Monitor Essentials, Azure Search, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Backup (MAB), and Service Bus. Impacted customers may observe degraded performance, reduced availability, or delayed telemetry as services continue to recover.


Current Status:

Earlier today, an unexpected utility power interruption at one of our West US datacenters resulted in a loss of power to portions of the facility. Power has since stabilized, and infrastructure and compute are being restored in controlled phases with continuous validation to ensure a safe and stable recovery.

During restoration, we identified a single cluster housing two storage stamps that remained in an unhealthy state following initial power and infrastructure recovery. This condition caused data to remain unavailable for dependent components and required additional remediation before broader storage recovery actions could proceed. Restoration efforts for this cluster are ongoing.

As recovery progresses, we are seeing a continued reduction in the number of unhealthy virtual machines and improvements across resources dependent on impacted storage accounts. Data availability and telemetry recovery are occurring gradually and may take additional time as services rehydrate and backlog processing completes.


Services Recovered and Healthy

Azure Databricks, Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server, Azure SQL DW, Azure SQL Managed Instances, Azure Event Hub, Service Bus should now be recovered and back to a healthy state.

Most of the affected downstream services are now progressing towards recovery, with teams closely monitoring the health metrics as these services catch up with backlog processing.


Ongoing Mitigation and Recovery Workstreams

Our teams are actively engaged in several parallel workstreams to restore full-service health. These include continued validation of datacenter power and environmental stability, targeted recovery of the affected storage cluster and associated stamps, and controlled reintroduction of dependent compute and platform services.

In parallel, we are monitoring virtual machine health, restarting impacted workloads where safe to do so, and validating storage data consistency before re‑enabling full access. Telemetry pipelines are also recovering as services come back online, and customers may continue to see delayed or partial monitoring data until backlog processing completes.

Current efforts are focused on a subset of storage and compute nodes which are taking longer than expected to recover or may need additional steps. Within this subset, we are making gradual progress as long tail recovery, given these resources need manual intervention and additional diagnosis.


Next Steps: At this time, we do not have an estimated time for full resolution. Customers may continue to see incremental signs of recovery as these mitigation efforts progress.

The next update will be provided within 60 minutes, or sooner if there are significant changes to share.
